i first discovered the monster hunter franchise years ago when world first came out, and i just bought it on a new pc recently and i ' ve rediscovered how good of a game this really environments and locales that you fight the unique monsters in are fantastic and immersive, and all the weapons deserve their own are so many things that make this game great and probably one of the best you ' ll ever play, so just give it a go and play

multiplayer is a bit funky, dc ' s you when you tab out sometimes. can ' t join missions unless everyone has seen the cutscenes first. dialogue doesn ' t sync up at all lmao besides that weird stuff the game is dope. improves on the series, looks and runs great for the most part ( 1 in 10 fights i ' ll get a 5 second fps stutter ). great co op when you get going, great incentives to get out there and learn the area ' s and hunt more monsters. fun fights, great progression system. also, don ' t make the same mistake i did and learn about the research and investigations nearly 100 hours in. you basically stack up to 50 side objectives like " hunt x of this monster " or " capture x amount of this monster ". adds up to a lot of extra stuff like armor spheres if you just make sure you top those up every so often, even every 10 - 20 quests. best played with 2 + players. solo is still totally viable but you ' ll do a little extra feel like i should mention there is a fairly steep learning curve, still learning some of the basics like 100 hours in, have only gotten the hang of 2 of the weapon types. try and

this is one of those instances where i wish steam had a neutral absolutely love monster hunter and this game is no exception. the issue however, as noted by many other people, is the pc port. i had mhw on ps4 and was excited to get it on pc since my pc easily out performs the console. unfortunately, this port is so poorly optimized that it actually runs worse on my pc despite having a gtx 1070. constant stutters and moments of extreme frame skipping. going from 60 + fps to 10 - 15. i cannot for the life of me connect to an online session my first attempt. it always returns an said, i love this game. i ' m still going to play this game, but if capcom doesn ' t fix these issues i ' ll probably never buy a pc port from them again.

important update on multiplayer : the devs have now fixed seemingly all connection update on mouse controls : the devs added a raw input mouse control type. this control type makes your mouse behave just like you would expect in any fps / 3rd person game without any floatiness to it. it feels update : motion blur can now be turned is my first time playing a monster hunter game and so far i ' m having an absolute blast. i ' m going to focus on the game ' s performance in this " review " because there are plenty of reviews about the gameplay and mechanics from more experienced and knowledgeable people than was hesitant to buy this at first because of all the posts about poor performance, mouse acceleration and motion blur / depth of field problems but ended up biting the bullet and turns out that - at least for me - it ' s not nearly as bad as people are making it out to system specs are as follows : processor : i7 - 7700k at geforce gtx 1070 ram : 16gb i ' ve been running the game on 1920x1080 max settings except for " volume rendering quality " being turned off and i ' ve never dipped below 60 fps. i found volume rendering quality to be the biggest fps killer in this

since about half the issues are fixed i ' ll just go ahead and put the review to recommended since it ' s still a good game even though it still has some port much as i want to give this game a positive review i ' ll give it a not recommended for now. i ' ve played the ps4 version to hr 70 - 80 clocking in at somewhere between 100 - 200 hours so that ' s what i ' ll be comparing it to now after around 30 hours of gameplay in the pc version reaching the last few story to the ps4 version : * load times, the ps4 pro with the standard hdd was a very horrible experience, in fact it was so bad that i went and got a ssd for it only to still suffer extreme load times even though they literally halved. the pc version on a 850 evo ssd loads so fast that it ' s the menu animations limiting how fast you can go into a mission. great fps, so for ps4 pro i used the performance mode which was a variable frame rate of 30 - 60 with a resolution of 1080p. it was basically 35 - 45 mostly and being used to g - synced 50 - 100 fps in the majority of titles i play it felt

i have completed the console version and spent 100 hours on it. here is my pc version hunter ' s rig gpu : geforce gtx 1070 gigabyte gaming g1 overclocked core 139mhz memory 400mhz cpu : intel ( r ) core ( tm ) i5 - 4690k cpu @ overclock 16 gb ram gb ram usable ) game installed on hdd controller dualshock 4 optimisation - mixed reaction as expected for a console port. that said, amazing effort from the devs. the game runs in 1080p flawlessly. there is frame drops in some areas, so you may be looking at 40 - 60fps with all high settings. but 60fps is more than enough to make up for this port. if you have experienced the console version you will definitely welcome the improvements here. loading times are 3 - 5 secs!!! and that ’ s only on a - same as console port. but with the option to run in 60fps you will feel the difference. the weather effects are much better and the textures look - same mechanics with joining instances. similar to how you join quest in warframe or diablo 3. monster hunter is a growing community and

after playing this game for a few days for 10 + hours each day i have to say while this game is fun it has many issues that need to be addressed. one is a major issue and the others are only minor issues. without further concern i will discuss my view about the multiplayer [ / u ] [ / h1 ] while it is fun playing the game online with friends the glaring problem is staying connected to friend sessions. the usual error was error code : 50382 - mw1. this error kicks people from the current session and they lose whatever resources they used up. there wouldn ' t be an issue if it was a rarely occuring issue but the problem happened at a rate of every 15 - 20 minutes. over a course of 10 hours of playing this equates to having an issue happening 30 - 40 times. in some cases players would have to close the game to be able to return to playing multiplayer with friends. there is also an issue that occasionally after being booted and getting back in the game with friends you ' ll get a " failed to join quest " error. not sure how this is an issue since it occured on console version as the recommended method of getting around the multplayer issue is as follows. right click
it fun to play with you ' re friends

this is my first review on steam even though i ' m 2 games short to reaching 100 games in my library. this game is the same old game i used to play on psp. and it is totaly awesome. but it ' s best to play with friends. cannot recommend the game until they fix the multiplayer issues, which is totally unplayable. 3 days i ' ve been playing, i only managed to connect to online session twice. twice in 8 hours of gaming. after that the following " always " happen. want to search for online session? " error code : xxxxx " want to create a session? " error code : xxxxx " want to join friend ' s session? " error code : xxxxx "

mhw is a fun game with lots of contant and many hours of gameplay, i would recommend it to friends if only the issues regarding constant disconnections is fixed. for a game advertised as an online multiplayer game i shouldn ' t constantly have to restart a new multiplayer session every 20 minutes because of disconnects.
it fun to play with you ' re friends

capcom why are you incompetent and can ' t fix your multiplayer system it has been a couple years already and we still got to do story missions until you ' re able to send " sos flares " then you can start playing with your friends. why not fix this issue and just let people start with a four person lobby so people can enjoy this game pain free. everything else about this game i really like just don ' t really see myself wanting to keep playing it if it ' s going to be such a drag to play with friends. do better in your future games and fix this!

as a person that has been waiting for this game since its console launch i was extremely excited for this game to hit steam and honestly i ' m not disappointed to much. the game plays well with for controllers, however its keyboard and mouse is pretty awful from what i have heard. the monster introductions requiring you to start most story quests by yourself is really strange but isn ' t to bad for coop and the i have had barely any connection issues so far. for me whenever i am in an expedition for a decent amount of time i will typically drop from my online session. also if i am co - oping with my friend if i post a quest before he gets into the gathering hub he will not be able to join with the message " failed to join apart from that i have not had any real issues with the online play including responding to sos and i don ' t have amazing internet by any means. i think this game ' s internet is pretty hit or miss, whether you have luck or not, which is not is a really good game but not a amazing port, i do hope that capcom will fix some of their issues. but i will still confidently recommend this game.

to the series [ / h1 ] word of advice, don ' t sos on every monsters. try to conquer it yourself solo, learn about the monsters, then if you failed the quest for over 5 times, feeling fed up and want to continue. that ' s when you should call for the help of the gods ( hunters who cleared the game and reached godhood ). defender equipment is ugly but strong, the hunters have mixed feeling about this armor. [ b ] but in my opinion, defender should not be used, since you are new and you wanna know how to play the game. defender equipment is just an end game worthy equipment for the base game. avoid it if you wanna enjoy the game [ / b ] unless you tried and failed a quest a lot, still wanna solo the quest instead of asking the help of the gods, then sure defender is the way to tl ; dr [ / h1 ] game is good. 10 / 10 see new monster - tries beatin it - beat / fail - craft new armor from new monster / farm equipment to beat monster - sos if all things fail - [ b ] repeat [ / b ] the endgame is best suited with a friend!

, especially tempered ones, but killing them doesn ' t take as long if you are good at avoiding getting hit. is that really a bad thing? 2. it ' s too easy. - tempered monsters are almost exactly on the same level damage - wise as g - rank difficulty in mh3u or mh4u. i don ' t really understand these complaints. 3. there aren ' t enough monsters. - there are less than usual, i do agree with that. although there are a plethora of great monsters, a bit more variance could have improved it even more. however - i think what is there, is going to be sufficient and enjoyable even for series veterans. especially alongside the much more enjoyable free roaming expeditions and the fun of looking for secrets and interesting things within each area in the there ' s no g - rank - just because there isn ' t a g - rank " in name " doesn ' t mean there aren ' t g - rank level challenges all over the place in the game. tempered monsters seemed to me like a very similar challenge to g - rank monsters in previous games. and honestly, i don ' t understand why people like the idea of " restarting from the beginning but slightly harder " a third time.

i ' ll throw it in that the new base game and iceborne monsters fit in well enough with the returning ones in the franchise, thumbs up for added as of october 2020 : lots of layered armor sets for the player to get in the master rank endgame. master rank layered armor was a long - requested feature to be added, and it finally was added as of october 2020 : the final, final endgame boss, fatalis, is probably one of the most challenging fights i ' ve ever seen in a monster hunter game and is a lot of fun. a refreshing change from how much of a pushover he was in previous games. it should be hard, given howl his armor set is very op op. ( note that his hitboxes are still extremely poorly done in some small cases, a minor complaint i ' ve had with the game and the series as a whole since i started the bad : - terrible meta due to insanely overpowered, terrible balancing / power creep for two armor sets : 1 : defender, a low rank and high rank armor set. there ' s also defender weapons that are just flat out better than anything else at that tier, and are both available at the start to those who purchase iceborne, allowing those users to get

while the game looks great and will initially seem fun, if you don ' t have players to actually play with it ' s terrible. then there is the added defender weapons and the guardian armor meant to be used by new players to blitz the game ' s original content to get to the expansion content. these do make it easier, they ruin the experience of trying to learn the monsters and actually do what the intended way to play the game if you have friends that want to help, they can ' t join you on story missions until you get through the initial cut scene where the new monster you are hunting for the quest completes. then you ' re supposed to put up an sos flare to get them to come help and while you do that, the monster is hitting your and eating you. this game seriously needs others to play with you if you aren ' t going to use the op weapons and armor given to play on easy mode for the beginning, yet getting other to play with is a pain and clunky. why can ' t we start fresh character and complete the story together at the same time i don ' t know. why others can ' t join you because you need to watch a cut scene first i don ' t know. thought this would be fun

, especially tempered ones, but killing them doesn ' t take as long if you are good at avoiding getting hit. is that really a bad thing? 2. it ' s too easy. - tempered monsters are almost exactly on the same level damage - wise as g - rank difficulty in mh3u or mh4u. i don ' t really understand these complaints. 3. there aren ' t enough monsters. - there are less than usual, i do agree with that. although there are a plethora of great monsters, a bit more variance could have improved it even more. however - i think what is there, is going to be sufficient and enjoyable even for series veterans. especially alongside the much more enjoyable free roaming expeditions and the fun of looking for secrets and interesting things within each area in the there ' s no g - rank - just because there isn ' t a g - rank " in name " doesn ' t mean there aren ' t g - rank level challenges all over the place in the game. tempered monsters seemed to me like a very similar challenge to g - rank monsters in previous games. and honestly, i don ' t understand why people like the idea of " restarting from the beginning but slightly harder " a third time.

monster hunter has never been this accessible, and i love it. as a long time player of the series ( started with portable 3rd ), it ' s amazing to see all of the core aspects of mh maintained in this new and revamped package that takes heavy inspiration from the combat systems of gu and 4u and expands them with even better mobility and responsiveness. new players can expect to find a very welcoming experience that starts very easy, but ramps up in difficulty towards the end - game. as for iceborne, the difficulty curves up 90°, monsters will demand better tactics and more preparation, making for some of the absolute best fights in the 5th generation. graphically, the game is stunning and filled with detail, the soundtrack has many remastered themes from previous titles, as well as many new ones, and all of them are incredible to listen to, and the customization options the new skill system brings will surely have you making sets and sets of armor and when you start up the game, you are given a set of armor and weapons called guardian / defender respectively. do not use these if you ' ve never played the game before, since they ' re meant to get you quickly to the dlc and completely break the base worldborne gets an easy

the defender set which is a set of armour and weapon that you start off with that can take you from the start and to the end of the base game. it does make things easier but there will be a point towards the end of the base game where it won ' t save you as much as it does during the early stages of the game. the point and benefit to this armour is that it will allow you to not stress over hunting down monsters for their materials to craft new gear all the time so new players can enjoy the base game. the defender set does become useless once players reach the expansion. once the story is over you can either move on to the expansion or enjoy the free content that was released for the base game. it ' s a lot. moving on to the expansion iceborne ; more of the same, 2 new biomes, 1 that is only unlocked after the story is complete. the expansion ups the difficulty with the master rank hunts, bigger monsters that are bigger and more aggressive that are just down right bad ass. new gear / weapons to farm for if you choose to. and similar to the base game, once the story is over there is still all the end game content to be had. this series of games provides tons of quality gaming

un juego muy adictivo que consiste en cazar monstruos, tienes muchos tipos de armas diferentes y bastantes monstruos para cazar, el contenido base es muy bueno incluso pasada la historia, teniendo un gameplay excelente y demas, no puedo recomendarlo lo suficiente.

gran juego, no es para todos, tienes que invertir algo de tiempo. vas a tener que matar al mismo monstruo varias veces para poder juntar la armadura / arma que quieres, y a algunas personas eso los puede frustrar. si ya conoces la saga te va a gustar, si no la conoces pero te gustan las peleas dificiles tipo jefes de dark soul es muy probable que te guste. buenos controles, todas las armas se sienten diferentes, buenas graficas. personalmente no he tenido problemas con rendimiento, ni con el juego base ni con la expansion, parece que la mayoria de las quejas son personas que tienen computadoras de gama alta y no les corre el juego como quisieran. o quizas he tenido suerte.

hacerte espadas arcos ropa etc, tienes qu ematarlo mas de una ves ya que una sola ves no te alcanza para armadura ropa y todo, lo cual te lleva a muchas muchas horas de juegoe n un solo mounstro, y hace que sea un juego mp,. en esta ultima version del 2018 yo no vi nada nuevo que no allla visto, solo un par de monstros nuevos y mejores graficos, pero la trama sigue siendo la misma, es un juego lleno de colores y diversion y cosas por descubrir en el cual te vas a divertir bastante jugando con amigos [ eso es si tienes claro ]

no vi muchas review en espanol asi que dejare la mia en espanol. no es un juego facil de entrada, es inevitable compararlo con los souls, aunque no es tan dificil como un souls en cuanto a recursos, si tiene una curva importante de aprendizaje igual que un souls. de entrada te comes un monton de informacion que no sabes para que te sirve, no sabes que esta bien o que esta mal, y aunque este juego se esfuerza por explicarte y darte tutoriales ( a diferencia que en souls ), te lo explican todo tan rapido que no te terminas de enterar de todo. nuevos jugadores : si tienen amigos que les recomendaron, pidanles ayuda y explicaciones para entender todo mas tranquilamente, si estas solo y pensando en comprar este juego busca guias e informacion por internet, sugiero fextralife. las guias

##les. el mundo es grande, dividido en varias zonas, con sus diferentes desafios. lo mas entretenido, es la variedad de monstruos que hay para pelear, lo que hace que quieras seguir jugando. el modo cooperativo es otro de sus puntos fuertes, ya que combinar diferentes perfiles para pelear contra los monstruos es muy divertido. el unico punto en contra son las cinematicas largas a modo pelicula en los puntos principales de la historia y el tiempo que se tarda en recorrer ciertos puntos del mapa, algo un poco irrelevante despues de la experiencia de juego.

un juego muy adictivo que consiste en cazar monstruos, tienes muchos tipos de armas diferentes y bastantes monstruos para cazar, el contenido base es muy bueno incluso pasada la historia, teniendo un gameplay excelente y demas, no puedo recomendarlo lo suficiente.

gran juego, no es para todos, tienes que invertir algo de tiempo. vas a tener que matar al mismo monstruo varias veces para poder juntar la armadura / arma que quieres, y a algunas personas eso los puede frustrar. si ya conoces la saga te va a gustar, si no la conoces pero te gustan las peleas dificiles tipo jefes de dark soul es muy probable que te guste. buenos controles, todas las armas se sienten diferentes, buenas graficas. personalmente no he tenido problemas con rendimiento, ni con el juego base ni con la expansion, parece que la mayoria de las quejas son personas que tienen computadoras de gama alta y no les corre el juego como quisieran. o quizas he tenido suerte.

o jogo e bem estranho de inicio, jogue por umas 6 horas direto antes de avaliar, e um jogo com uma dificuldade bacana e um sistema que nao agrada muito jogadores que ficam socando teclas ( nutella ), e extremamente satisfatorio matar um monstro " especial ", digo que nunca senti algo assim com qualquer rpg antes, nem mesmo hack ' n ' slash, voce realmente sente que esta cacando o monstro, ja que os mesmos possuem um certo realismo na minha opiniao ( eles tao apanhando muito? " corre berg ", iiiii olha la outro monstro grandao lutando com um humaninho, bora incomodar ( voce pode ate mesmo utilizar esse fator a sua vantagem ) ) atencao!!! : o jogo e focado somente em lutar com os monstros, entao nao es

ja tenho o jogo a mais de 2 anos porem so parei para finalizar a expansao do iceborne agora. em todos esse tempo que joguei ( e continuo jogando ) esse incrivel jogo de caca a monstros, so tenho uma coisa a vai fundo. ( yamete ta falando serio, o jogo e lindo, os monstros sao incriveis em cada detalhe, cada luta, cada mecanica ( tirando a mecanica de enfraquece - los com a clutch claw, isso e um cada cenario, as variedades de design de armaduras e armas, bem vcs entenderam. da para perder horas nesse jogo facil! entao resumindo : e fan da franquia? nao preciso dizer que pode jogou nenhum monster hunter? vai fundo, e um otimo jogo da franquia para tem o monster hunter rise? ai fica por sua decisa

so it has been a while since i last played mhw, stop playing right at the end because the content i had left to do was locked behind coop and i dont usually play with people so i decided to stop there. but i went far into the game to have a good opinion about it. in short this game is nothing short of amazing, probably one of my all time favourite games. it really ticks all the boxes, good graphics, good gameplay, good story, variety of weapons and gear, really is an amazing game, i started using the great sword, but i just couldnt get use to the movement set so i decided to use the bow. and this is pretty much the only weapon i have used there are so many other options for a player to choose from, dual blades, axe, glaive, etc. and each require a different skill set, meaning that they are different from each other so i am sure you will find a weapon that you enjoy using and the best part is that if you start with a weapon you dont like you can always change and try something else. i also like how i slowly improved my gear as i was going through the story, so i could set myself a goal knowing that when i get

of optional and special quests stuff including stuff like raid boss monsters intended to be tackled by a full team of 4 hunters and arena quests with premade loadouts. there is a decent amount of grind in this game and it is somewhat core to the gameplay although it is far more generous and less time consuming than other grindy games i have played, it is entirely possible to get the best possible endgame loadout setup for multiple weapons within 300 hrs of play from new game. there is no player class or level - up system in this game, your character remains the same at end - game as you were at start, instead what changes is the weapons and armor you use, along with the item and tool loadout you carry + the skills you developed. all armor pieces in this game have skills associated with them that can have a multitude of effects which can be further customised with slot - in items. you hunt and maybe farm strong monsters, then you ' ll use their parts to craft weapons and armor from that same monster to prep for the hunt of the next stronger monster. monsters can inflict a variety of statuses and ailments and have innate weaknesses and resistances to different elemental types you can attack them with, preparation for each hunt can

alright, i played this game for 200 hours, i should probs make a in general is great, but you need, need to know a couple things : 1 - mh as a beginner is frustrating, as learning how to fight each monster in the game is difficult and punishing, especially later on. be prepared to fight monsters many a time just to kill them once, unless you get carried in multiplayer, but even then, when you dont die enough to fail the mission for the team - 2 - you are going to be killing monsters likely a few to alot of times to make their respective armor sets / weapons to have better gear for future monsters. this can be eased by the guardian armor set which is easy to upgrade and use all the way to the end of the base game, but was designed for people rushing the base game to iceborne, and drops off there. and even then, it might not carry you at times with resistances and stuff ( its been awhile since base game for me, but in the endgame, yeah, your going to be making armor quite a bit unless a armor set just clicks and has everything you need ( which is rare ) and still will be eventually replaced at some point until the game is fully complete

love the had played the older ones a long time ago but never really got into waited for quite a while to buy the game and was gifted by a friend of on and played for hours. if you like grinding games, while hunting monsters with friends or randoms this is something for you. you can solo the monsters easily so you can either solo or play with others it entirely up to armor sets and weapon sets are well designed, the environments are designed easily to get around in and use the terrain while game is well worth the the recent update of the defender armor set and weapon line, i suggest if you are new to the game and want the real mhw experience. do not use this armor, it is overpowered by alot ( which is the point to get you to the new dlc launching soon ) enjoy your game - play.

love the had played the older ones a long time ago but never really got into waited for quite a while to buy the game and was gifted by a friend of on and played for hours. if you like grinding games, while hunting monsters with friends or randoms this is something for you. you can solo the monsters easily so you can either solo or play with others it entirely up to armor sets and weapon sets are well designed, the environments are designed easily to get around in and use the terrain while game is well worth the the recent update of the defender armor set and weapon line, i suggest if you are new to the game and want the real mhw experience. do not use this armor, it is overpowered by alot ( which is the point to get you to the new dlc launching soon ) enjoy your game - play.

oh man where do i begin with this hunter has been a long going series and because of this game it ' s been becoming very popular and i love started play this series back with 4u on the 3ds and i have loved it so much. i will say this. mhw is imo the easiest and kindest mh game for new players to hop weapon is different so if you don ' t like one try another one. i will say. the hardest part about playing on pc is the gap we have with console players. but with iceborne coming out we are currently caught until iceborne actually releases. console gets it next month and pc gets it in january. this happened with the base game when it came out so we kinda use to it back to fun stuff. armor ' s in this game look amazing. the monster that returned look so good. the new monsters are just as cool as the original ones from older games. combat in this game is the best. you aren ' t fighting the controls like you kinda did in the old one gripe with this game. and if you ' ve played other mh games you know what i ' m talking about. the weapons look certain ones look amazing but a good bit of them are just the

bad the hitboxes that was intentional game design to make the monsters harder, but that shouldn ' t be the way to increase difficulty, it once again, does not feel good to play against and makes the game less is a perfect example of how the hitboxes should ' ve been, for all weapon variety a lot of people complained that most weapons didn ' t look unique personally thought that was a silly complain when the real issue is that in the endgame there are only like 1 - 6 viable weapon options depending on your target and the weapon you example, if you play longsword anything but the fatalis blade is unviable and there is no reason to take anything else unless the target monster is weak to blast, then you have another i ' m trying to say is that most elemental weapons suck really hard and they should ' ve made them quite a bit stronger. they either have extremely bad sharpness combined with extremely bad raw or so little elemental damage that you might as well the one that deals almost 20 % more raw ranged weapons deal more damage than melee so the safe options deals more damage, aight got it. * cough * sticky ammo * cough * people new to the series probably shouldn ' t read too much into these cons,

i have played most of the mh games and i have to say, they really improved the formula in this one. this game has some really good changes that take a lot of the pointless garbage out of it. there ' s still tons of different play styles based on the wide variety of weapons and armor, so it never really feels stale or old. it ' s also very easy to get help with harder monsters, which is a huge plus. you still really have to wear gear that has strengths / resisitances based on the monster you ' re going after. i like this because it actually makes you think, not just mindless only thing i wish they would do is make armor a bit more customizable appearance wise. you have to mix and match a lot and can end up looking really goofy. that ' s really the only issue i have with the game, other than that minor issue it ' s really solid. i would definitely recommend this game to long time mh players, or brand new players.
